docs.snippet: The United States national team’s first game since the Gold Cup will be a rematch of the final with Mexico on Aug. 10 in Philadelphia.
docs.lead_paragraph: The United States national team’s first game since the Gold Cup will be a rematch of the final with Mexico on Aug. 10 in Philadelphia.
docs.abstract: United States men's national soccer team's first game since the Gold Cup will be a friendly rematch of the final with Mexico in August; other soccer news noted.

docs.snippet: Mario Alberto Kempes will have the pleasure of analyzing three soccer matches during Copa América at the stadium named for him in Córdoba, Argentina.
docs.lead_paragraph: For millions of Argentines, his name ranks high along with anyone named Perón, or Maradona.
docs.abstract: Mario Alberto Kempes will have the pleasure of analyzing three soccer matches during Copa América at the stadium named for him in Córdoba, Argentina.

headline.main: Live From Estadio Mario Alberto Kempes … It’s Mario Alberto Kempes

docs.snippet: Argentina and Brazil, the favorites to win the Copa América, have yet to win a game in the tournament.
docs.lead_paragraph: The 12 teams in the Copa América have all played two of their three first-round games. Costa Rica, Venezuela and Peru all have wins under their belts. Argentina, Brazil and Uruguay do not.
docs.abstract: Argentina and Brazil, the favorites to win the Copa América, have yet to win a game in the tournament.

headline.main: Is It Panic Time for the Copa América Favorites?

docs.snippet: Should Mexico’s Concacaf neighbors, notably the one to the north, be worried about its second under-17 world championship in six years? Maybe.
docs.lead_paragraph: Mexico won the FIFA Under-17 World Cup for the second time on Sunday, continuing its recent run of success at the junior level with a 2-0 victory over Uruguay at the Azteca Stadium in Mexico City.
docs.abstract: Should Mexico’s Concacaf neighbors, notably the one to the north, be worried about its second under-17 world championship in six years? Maybe.

docs.snippet: Argentina sailed into the quarterfinals of the Copa América with a 3-0 victory over Costa Rica on Monday night, and Lionel Messi was at the controls the whole way.
docs.lead_paragraph: Maybe Lionel Messi wasn’t the problem after all.
docs.abstract: Argentina sailed into the quarterfinals of the Copa América with a 3-0 victory over Costa Rica on Monday night, and Lionel Messi was at the controls the whole way.

headline.main: Copa América: Argentina Advances Behind Messi

docs.snippet: Uruguay defeated Mexico, 1-0, to finish second in Group C of the Copa América, setting up a quarterfinal with Argentina.
docs.lead_paragraph: Uruguay defeated Mexico, 1-0, to finish second in Group C of the Copa América, setting up a quarterfinal with Argentina.
docs.abstract: Uruguay defeats Mexico, 1-0, to advance along with Chile out of Group C in Copa America soccer tournament.

docs.snippet: The favorites in the Copa América all advanced to the quarterfinals, but they will all need to be better than they have been so far.
docs.lead_paragraph: The first round of the Copa América ended with a flurry of goals on Wednesday night, with Brazil fighting off Ecuador, 4-2, and Paraguay and Venezuela playing to a 3-3 tie after the former threw away a late 3-1 lead.
docs.abstract: The favorites in the Copa América all advanced to the quarterfinals, but they will all need to be better than they have been so far.

docs.snippet: The Argentine striker Sergio Agüero has finally stepped out of some all-consuming shadows that have long shaded his soccer career.
docs.lead_paragraph: What’s the dinner conversation like these days at Sergio Agüero’s house when his in-laws visit?
docs.abstract: The Argentine striker Sergio Agüero has finally stepped out of some all-consuming shadows that have long shaded his soccer career.

headline.main: Sergio Agüero, the Son-in-Law of God, Escapes Long Shadows

docs.snippet: Uruguay eliminated Argentina and joined surprising Peru in the Copa América semifinals.
docs.lead_paragraph: Argentina was eliminated from the Copa América quarterfinals by Uruguay in a penalty kick shootout on Saturday night, a fitting and maddening denouement for the host country in a tournament in which its talented team alternated between fabulous and (more often) frustrating.
docs.abstract: Uruguay eliminated Argentina and joined surprising Peru in the Copa América semifinals.

headline.main: Copa América Semifinals: Argentina Is Out
